s.text: It also refers to the individual articles on the op-ed page (e.g., "Henry Kissinger's New York Times op-ed on the nuclear test ban treaty").
The term originally referred to the pieces of lead which held the type in place on printing presses.
Stuff (as a verb): To place a story inside the paper.
Op-Ed: The page in a newspaper where opinion pieces not written by the paper's editorial board appear.
Reefer : A brief front-page synopsis of a story that appears inside the paper.
